com.jgaap.backend
Class findClasses

java.lang.Object
  com.jgaap.backend.findClasses
Deprecated. 

@Deprecated
public class findClasses
extends java.lang.Object

This class dynamically locates subclasses of a given named superclass within a specific directory. You can use it, for example, to find all (e.g.) Preprocessors and populate the GUI with them automatically, eliminating the need to recompile JGAAP every time you add a new canonicizer.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Juola

Method Detail

findAll

public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> findAll(java.lang.String directory,
                                                         java.lang.String theclass)
Deprecated. 
Search named directory for all instantiations of the type named.

Parameters:
directory - The directory to search for a given (super)class
theclass - The (super)class for finding all subclasses of
Returns:
A Vector containing the names of all .class files representing subclasses of 'theclass'.

getSubClasses

public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<?>> getSubClasses(java.net.URI directory,
                                                                     java.lang.String parentClassName,
                                                                     java.lang.String subClassesPrefix)
Deprecated. 
This method is used to return a Collection of Class objects without actually instantiating any instances of the classes they are linked to. This method is a convenience method for calling the other version of getSubClasses without needing to worry about having a Class object.

Parameters:
directory - The directory to search.
parentClassName - The fully qualified name of the parent class. For example, Canonicizer's fully qualified name is "com.jgaap.generics.Canonicizer".
subClassesPrefix - This is a String that contains the first part of a fully qualified name. To check the class files in com/jgaap/canonicizers, this argument would be "com.jgaap.canonicizers.". Note the final dot.
Returns:
A Collection of Class objects, each representing a valid subclass of the parent class passed as an argument

getSubClasses

public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<?>> getSubClasses(java.net.URI directory,
                                                                     java.lang.Class<?> parentClassName,
                                                                     java.lang.String subClassesPrefix)
Deprecated. 
This method is used to return a Collection of Class objects without actually instantiating any instances of the classes they are linked to.

Parameters:
directory - The directory to search.
parentClassName - Actual Class instance linking to the class that will be treated as the parent class.
subClassesPrefix - This is a String that contains the first part of a fully qualified name. To check the class files in com/jgaap/canonicizers, this argument would be "com.jgaap.canonicizers.". Note the final dot.
Returns:

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Deprecated. 
Main routine for testing. Lists (on the screen) all subclasses of the type(s) named as argument(s).

Parameters:
args - The second EventSet
